com.example.android.camera2video

Class NetConn

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.android.camera2video.NetConn
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    class NetConn
extends Object
implements Serializable
    This class will allow for a single location for all network messages to flow through. This will help us because we have 2 activities in use on the app. This class will be a singleton class and will also use the Observer design pattern to notify the rest of the app that a network message has been received.
    Version:
    1.0.3 Observer ReadLoop Observable
    Author:
    Jonathan Westerfield

    • Constructor Detail

      • NetConn

        private NetConn()
        Empty Default Class constructor.

      • NetConn

        private NetConn(String ipAddr,
                int port)
        Class constructor. Isn't needed because this class is a singleton class.
        Parameters:
        ipAddr - The IP address we are trying to connect to (the laptop).
        port - The port number that we must go through.

      • NetConn

        private NetConn(String ipAddr,
                int port,
                String username,
                String password)
        Class constructor. Isn't needed because this class is a singleton class.
        Parameters:
        ipAddr - The IP address we are trying to connect to (the laptop).
        port - The port number that we must go through.
        username - The username of the user on the laptop.
        password - The password of the user on the laptop.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        static NetConn getInstance()
        The way other classes and objects can access this singleton object.
        Returns:
        The single instance of this class.

      • setIPAddress

        public NetConn setIPAddress(String ip)
        Setter for this class instance IP address. This uses the builder pattern.
        Parameters:
        ip - The IP address we are trying to connect to (the laptop).
        Returns:
        The current instance of this class for the builder design pattern.

      • setPortNumber

        public NetConn setPortNumber(int port)
        Setter for this class instance port number. This uses the builder pattern.
        Parameters:
        port - The port number that we must go through to establish a TCP connection.
        Returns:
        The current instance of this class for the builder design pattern.

      • setUsername

        public NetConn setUsername(String username)
        Allows us to set the username needed to start the FTP process.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the user on the laptop.
        Returns:
        The current instance of this class for the builder design pattern.

      • setPassword

        public NetConn setPassword(String password)
        Allows us to set the password needed to start the FTP process.
        Parameters:
        password - The password of the user on the laptop.
        Returns:
        The current instance of this class for the builder design pattern.

      • setPhoneID

        public NetConn setPhoneID(String id)
        Allows us to set the phone ID so as to differentiate the video files that gets sent back to the laptop. Otherwise, both files would be named the same thing which would cause issues differentiating between the two further along in the process.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the phone passed in from the laptop.
        Returns:
        The current instance of the class as per the builder pattern.

      • getIpAddr

        public String getIpAddr()
        Getter for the current IP Address.
        Returns:
        The current IP address of the target.

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Getter for the currently set port number.
        Returns:
        The current port number.

      • getReader

        public BufferedReader getReader()
        Getter for the reader once it is instanciated.
        Returns:
        The buffered reader so we can start reading network messages.

      • getReadLoop

        public ReadLoop getReadLoop()
        Getter for the readloop so we can add a class as an observer.
        Returns:
        Our instance of the readloop.

      • getFtpConn

        public FTPConn getFtpConn()
        Getter for the user to access the FTP connection functions like setting the source or destination file locations.
        Returns:
        The current instance of the FTPConn class.

      • getPhoneID

        public String getPhoneID()
        Gets the id of the phone that is set by the laptop. This allows us to differentiate between the video files when they get sent back to the laptop.
        Returns:
        The ID of the phone (EX: 1 or 2)

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Is used to make sure the socket connection is currently connected and active.
        Returns:
        True if the connection is live, false otherwise.

      • createFTPConn

        public void createFTPConn()
                   throws InstantiationException
        Creates this classes instance of the FTP connection. Any action to get to the FTP connection must come through this NetConn singleton instance.
        Throws:
        InstantiationException - Thrown if port number, ip address, username or password is not set

      • createConn

        public void createConn()
                throws InstantiationException,
                       UnknownHostException,
                       IOException
        Uses the class IP Address and port number to establish a connection with the the target address (the laptop).
        Throws:
        InstantiationException - Is thrown if the target IP address or port number haven't been set.
        UnknownHostException - Is thrown if the host IP address can't be found.
        IOException - Is thrown if the socket connection cannot be established.

      • startReadLoop

        public void startReadLoop()
        Spawns and starts a new thread for this class instance of the ReadLoop class so we can listen for network signals from the laptop. Since this ReadLoop instance is a part of this singleton class, it is also accessible to all other project objects and there should only be 1 in memory. By being a object belonging to a singleton object, the ReadLoop is also a singleton object. ReadLoop

      • createReader

        public void createReader()
                  throws IOException
        Creates the input stream reader to read incoming network messages.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws when there is an issue with the network stream.

      • createWriter

        public void createWriter()
                  throws IOException
        Creates the output stream writer to write messages to the other side of the network connection (the laptop).
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws when there is an issue with the network stream.

      • sendMessage

        public boolean sendMessage(String message)
                    throws IOException
        Sends a passed in message to the other side of the connection (the laptop).
        Parameters:
        message - The message we want to send across the connection.
        Throws:
        IOException - Is thrown when the message fails to send for some reason.

      • suscribeToListener

        public void suscribeToListener(Observer observer)
        Allows us to subscribe to the listener so that we can get updates from the laptop while the rest of the app is running.
        Parameters:
        observer - The object that needs to listen to the server. Observer ReadLoop Observable

      • closeConn

        public void closeConn()
        Used to close the connection if that is needed. Basically closes the connection and deletes the class. Do not call this unless the connection needs to be completely reset.
